page.title: 08Farming in Kimpton
page.content: The farming in this area is mostly arable. There are also some sheep, poultry and cattle.Modern machinery is used and pulled by tractors,which have a cab.Many drivers wear ear-muffs.All the work in the fields is done by machine e.g. harvesting by a combine- harvester;baling of the straw by a baler;a mowing machine is used for cutting grass for hay and silage. The Bury Farm is two farms together.They have two generators. Hall Farm is 100 yards behind the school.Sometimes we see a helicopter or a small aeroplane spraying the crops.Pollution sometimes causes a problem on surrounding land. Both farms grow wheat,oats,barley, field beans,oil-seed rape and potatoes. They use a rotation system.
